com.netflix.spectator.sandbox

Interface HttpClient


  • public interface HttpClient
    Simple blocking http client using HttpLogEntry and HttpURLConnection. This can be used as an example of the logging or for light use-cases where it is more desirable not to have dependencies on a more robust HTTP library. Usage: 
     HttpClient client = HttpClient.DEFAULT;
 HttpResponse response = client.get(URI.create("http://example.com")).send();
    For testing an alternative client implementation can be used to customize the send. For example to create a client that will always fail: 
     HttpClient client = (n, u) -> new HttpRequestBuilder(n, u) {
    @Override protected HttpResponse sendImpl() throws IOException {
     throw new ConnectException("could not connect to " + u.getHost());
   }
 };

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static HttpClient DEFAULT
      Client implementation based on HttpURLConnection.

      • newRequest

        HttpRequestBuilder newRequest(String clientName,
                              URI uri)
        Create a new request builder.
        Parameters:
        clientName - Name used to identify this client.
        uri - URI to use for the request.
        Returns:
        Builder for creating and executing a request.

      • get

        default HttpRequestBuilder get(URI uri)
        Create a new GET request builder. The client name will be selected based on a prefix of the host name.
        Parameters:
        uri - URI to use for the request.
        Returns:
        Builder for creating and executing a request.
